phrases: Wanting to make someone smile is a wonderful thing, is not it?
That is what being an Undine is all about!
But how do I do that?
That is what being an Undine is all about!
But how do I do that?
For me, it is when I eat something delicious.
That is actually kind of scary...
Dear Ai, the days continue to be warm here in Neo-Venezia,
so it is safe to say early summer has arrived.
Starting next month, I will have to say goodbye to my winter uniform for a while.
I am looking forward to it, but I am also a little sad about it, so it is a mysterious feeling.
I am quite proud of this dish.
I am looking forward to it.
Thank you for waiting, President Aria.
President Aria, you do not seem like your usual self.
Are you reading the Nyan Nyan Puu comic strip like you always do?
This is... an article about the Ca' d'Oro?
The Ca' d'Oro, a Gothic architectural masterpiece brought directly from Manhome's Venice...
Nyan Nyan Puu Perfect Guide Book coming soon?
You are in a good mood this morning.
Do you remember that day Oboeteimasuka ano hi o
When your heart suddenly began to race Futo kanjita tokimeki o
The rays from the blue sky were pouring over you...
I could not look away, and when our eyes met Mitoreru to me ga atte
I could not help but smile Egao koboreta
It is just like a spiral Marude supiraare
I want to spend my days waving to you Itsumademo te o furitai hibi
This is my proof that I was here with you Koko ni tashika ni kimi to ita akashi
There is a path which stretches on ahead Kono saki mo tsuzuiteru michi ga aru
When you climb the next hill, Tsugi no saka o nobottara
Let us meet again Mata aimashou
I read that article about the restoration work this morning, too.
It is because so many of the buildings in this city were brought from Manhome.
Like the Teatro La Fenice and the Accademia di Belle Arti, right?
There is also the Basilica di Santa Maria della Salute.
There is another church too, the Basilica di San Giorgio Maggiore.
Speaking of buildings brought over from Manhome, Caffe Florian was brought over too, right?
You can really get a sense of its long history from the beautiful rooms inside.
I wish I could see it.
That is really surprising since you are friends with the owner, Akari.
Since we are on the subject, why do not we go have some tea?
Let us go there for our break.
I get to see the inside!
What is the matter, President Aria?
Oh yeah, last month they started restoration work on this building too, did not they?
A student from the Neo-Venezia Art University did the artwork on the scaffold wraps.
Students had to submit their designs, and then the student who was chosen got to paint the wraps.
I heard it was really competitive.
Because in a sense, the wraps will be the city's face while they do the restoration.
Once the restoration work is complete, there will not be a use for them anymore, right?
But even if it is just for a short while, they will delight everyone, visitors and locals alike.
So in a way, it is Neo-Venezia's very own method of showing hospitality.
There is a bunch of people over there.
I wonder if they are selling something?
Is not he a patissier at the Hotel Appresso's restaurant?
Is not he a patissier at the Hotel Appresso's restaurant?
Is not he a patissier at the Hotel Appresso's restaurant?
Is not he a patissier at the Hotel Appresso's restaurant?
Himeya has a partnership with that hotel.
Himeya has a partnership with that hotel.
Himeya has a partnership with that hotel.
I have seen him there before.
I wonder why he is selling sweets here, then?
Maybe he quit his job at the hotel?
You want one too, do not you, Junior?
Should I buy one for our toddler friend?
You are the one who wants some, Aika.
After all, your brain age is really equal to a child.
I think I will buy some and send it to Ai.
Oh, look at what you have done.
It is glass, so it is dangerous, Miss Undine.
I will clean it up right away, so please just leave it there.
I will give you a new bottle of chocolates.
I feel kind of sorry for the chocolates...
Let us send them to Ai right away, President Aria.
I did not know there were so many paintings inside!
Each room has its own theme, like the Room of the Illustrious Men and the Room of Seasons.
Here is your caffe latte and hot milk.
The original caffe latte is the best, is not it?
The entire cafe is like an art museum.
You can hear the music coming in from outside...
Just thinking about the number of people who sat in this chair and used this table is so exciting!
I see you are having tea in here, even though it is beautiful outside.
It is because I have never actually been inside the cafe before.
How does the original caffe latte taste while sitting inside?
I think it has a slightly different taste.
It tastes the same either way, you know.
Now that we are all refreshed, shall we go back and study, then?
Maybe he closed up shop for today?
Looks like the restoration work for Ca' d'Oro started today.
The scaffolding has already been set up.
Get well, and show us your magnificent facade again soon.
I just saw that patissier from the other day.
Oh, the one who was selling chocolates?
I have not seen him in Piazza San Marco since that day.
I went to go buy chocolates after school the day before yesterday, but his shop was not there.
Come to think of it, I saw him in front of Palazzo Grimani yesterday.
He was just staring at the building.
He was staring at Ca' d'Oro just now, as well.
I wonder if he quit making sweets, and is researching buildings now?
I wonder if he is not going to sell chocolates anymore?
Sir, Madam, the bridge we are about to pass under is the Ponte dell'
It is a reconstruction of a bridge that used to be in Manhome's Venice.
It looks like it is made of wood, but the structure is actually made of steel.
It is headstrong, just like you.
Okay then, let us take a picture with Ponte dell'
Thank you for all the wonderful memories today.
I would love to come again.
When we do, please guide us again.
We will be looking forward to it.
Akari, you can take the rest of the day off.
I am going straight to the Gondola Association for a meeting now.
President Aria, would it be all right if we stopped by Piazza San Marco?
The chocolate shop is not here today, either.
Let us go see the main piazza, too.
This place never ceases to amaze me.
I get so excited just looking at all the different rooms.
I am glad to see you again.
It is all thanks to you!
Could you stop by Piazza San Marco tomorrow afternoon?
There is something I would like to give you.
There is so much I wanted to ask him, too...
Maybe he is not here yet?
You are going to reopen your shop?
Yes, and it is all thanks to you.
Remember how you said you felt sorry for the chocolates when the bottle broke?
When I heard that, I thought...
I want to make my customers smile.
Those chocolates were made with love, so it is sad...
I thought, When did I forget that feeling?
I was able to remember that, thanks to you.
I thought you had closed your shop for good.
I was trying to come up with another way to make people smile, and a better method of sharing it.
What if I used all sorts of different wrapping papers?
Sort of like how there are all sorts of different buildings in this city.
Ah, is that why you were at Ca' d'Oro and Ponte dell' Accademia yesterday?
It seems like you always catch me at the most unflattering moments.
When I am out of ideas, I walk around the city until I get tired.
When I do that, somehow it is easier to come up with something good.
Neo-Venezia gives you hints, does not it?
Please, pick any two you like, for you and your cat.
Take it as a token of my appreciation.
Then, I will take this one, and this one...
It feels like such a waste to even open the wrapping!
I would feel sorry for the chocolates if you did not eat them.
It is still a little early to set up shop, so may I treat you two to a caffe latte?
No matter how often you come here, it is still beautiful, is not it?
I always stop by Caffe Florian after I close my shop.
When I look at the paintings, it somehow puts me at ease.
It really does, does not it?
You are the gentleman who is always here...
Do you two know each other?
He is the owner of this cafe.
Do you like the paintings in here?
This entire cafe, interior and all, was dismantled and brought over before Venice was submerged.
All the paintings are the originals from back then.
You must take very good care of them.
Well, these paintings belong here, after all.
It is just a simple phrase, but there is a lot of meaning in those words.
The things people create are filled with the emotion of their makers.
That is why they get passed down, do not they?
They are cherished, and they belong...
Your chocolates are the same way, Anri!
Whether it is a big building or a small bundle of chocolates,
they are both the same because they were made with love!
That is why they make everyone smile!
Then, if my chocolates become something that belongs in this city...
They will be something wonderful that belongs here!
Then, in celebration of Neo-Venezia's newest addition,
may I treat you to some of Caffe Florian's special cioccolata?
You have not been around lately.
I am about to open my shop, so please wait just a little longer.
Dear Ai, something new and wonderful that belongs in Neo-Venezia has just been born.
They are chocolates that are incredibly sweet, and really cute.
Thank you for the chocolates, Akari!
They taste so delicious because the patissier made them with love, right?
A shore awash in golden waves Kin no nami kishibe ni
Filled with yearning, I open my eyes and it is morning Akogare mezameru no asa ni
As my thoughts focus intently on someone, Dareka no koto o tsuyoku omou toki
Love rests on my palm, held high Kakageta te no hira ni ai ga tomaru
A future guided by the flow of water and wind Mizu no yukue to kaze ga shimesu mirai
I gaze at the hope that surrounds this world Kono hoshi o tsusumu kibou mitsumete
The distant clouds of light are beckoning now Tooi kumo hikari ga sasou you ni yureru i am about to
A shore awash in golden waves Kin no nami kishibe ni
Filled with yearning, I open my eyes and it is morning Akogare mezameru no asa ni
